timeline.message:
Fixes #5057 Included root context path

Root context path in include should be empty string.

timeline.bodyText: You might want to remove the print here and log instead.
timeline.author: lachlan-roberts

timeline.bodyText: How does this compare to ContextHandler.Context.getContextPath()? see for example https://github.com/eclipse/jetty.project/blob/jetty-9.4.x/jetty-server/src/main/java/org/eclipse/jetty/server/handler/ContextHandler.java#L2421.
timeline.author: janbartel

replies.bodyText:
Interesting question, because I think ContextHandler.Context.getContextPath() is actually wrong in that it should be returning the encoded path.
Eitherway, I think we should only have one of the two methods.... stand by....
replies.author: gregw

replies.bodyText:
Question ...
What happens in this situation ...
$ cd /path/to/mybase
$ cd webapps
$ mkdir "this%2Fpath"
$ echo "can you see this" > "this%2Fpath/index.html"
What is the context path here?
replies.author: joakime

replies.bodyText:
I think technically it would be/this%252fpath and should be ok other than being confusing.
But we should test and I expect some nasties.
replies.author: gregw

replies.bodyText: But I'd prefer not to hold up this PR for that.
replies.author: gregw

timeline.message:
Issue #5057

merged context path methods as result of review.
ServletContent.getContextPath now returns the encoded contextPath (if anybody is silly enough to have one).
